root: ^Don Quixote: I give up, there is no way out. The mage is too good.

c-0: ^You: We can always fail in life, it's ok.
^Don Quixote: What do you mean fail? Well, at least I have met windmill giants before, probably some evil witches who dare not reveal their identities to me.
c-1: ^You: You don't have to be a knight, right? Why not something else?
^Don Quixote: Like what? My dear B.F.? I spent all my young years reading on how to be a knight.
g-0: ^Don Quixote: My life peaked when I tried to fight the windmill giants before, though they didn't fight back. I has all been down hill from there.
^At least, you had some old glory

c-0: ^You: Well, yeah, at least you had past glory in duelling the windmill giants.
^Don Quixote: And I shall cherish them as if they were treasure.
c-1: ^You:It's never too late to try something new
